title: Executive Order 6995-Coal Land Restoration, Montana No. 90
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910 (ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497), the Executive order of July 9, 1910, creating Coal Land Withdrawal, Montana No. 1, and the Executive order of February 24, 1911, creating Coal Land Withdrawal, Montana No. 7, are hereby revoked insofar as, and to the extent that, they affect the following-described lands:
T. 1 N., R. 49 E., secs. 1 to 9, inclusive;
sec. 10, N½, N½ SW¼, SE¼ SW¼, and SE¼;
T. 3 N., R. 50 E., secs. 1 to 27, inclusive;
sec. 28, NE¼, N½ NW¼, SE¼ NW¼, and S½; secs. 29 to 33, inclusive;
sec. 34, N½, NE¼ SW¼, S½ SW¼, and SE¼; secs. 35 and 36.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6995-Coal Land Restoration, Montana No. 90 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362675
